settings.id_your_single_subtitle: Cockroaches have been around for million of years with more than 3,500 species around the world. The German cockroach is one of the most common household cockroaches in the world. They are considered pests because it invades where we live, eat and sleep. They are not particularly fond of the cold and can contaminate food.
settings.page_long_description: Most roaches are nocturnal, that is, they prefer the night and are sensitive to all forms of light except for the red spectrum. Most active right after dusk and right before dawn
settings.side_bar_fact_description:
Scientific Name:

Blattodea

Color:
Most roaches are reddish-brown to black

Weight:
Max 30 grams

Length:
1-5cm long

Tail Length:
N/A

Body:
Body is divided into 3 parts: head, thorax and abdomen with 3 pairs of legs

Ears:
Long pair of antennae that helps them pick up smells and vibrations

Eyes:
Poor vision and dislike light

Lifespan:
Average lifespan is 20-30 weeks

Droppings:
Cockroaches produce many feces. They will go anywhere but their droppings tend to remain close to their nesting and feeding areas
